EXTRACTED VALUE: Chase Budinger (ankle) is out for Tuesday's game against the Rockets.
DeShawn Stevenson started at shooting guard on Wednesday but had just two points and three assists in 26 minutes.
Marcus Camby downplayed his sore right knee Wednesday night, saying he'll be fine.
Kevin Martin has averaged 23.1 points per game this season, despite averaging just 14.4 shots per game.
Malik Allen has been dealing with a strained groin over the last week, but he is probable for Wednesday's game against the Thunder.
Heat PF Juwan Howard (shoulder soreness) did not practice on Sunday but should be ready for Tuesday's opener, according to coach Erik Spoelstra.
Nenad Krstic will miss Friday's game with back spasms.
Carlos Boozer reported no soreness or pain in his right hand following his season debut on Wednesday.
Beat writer Mike Wells speculates that Dahntay Jones could be traded before the season starts.
The Blazers have officially signed veteran F/C Sean Marks.
Craig Smith (back) practiced on Monday but was limited to non-contact drills, and is questionable for Wednesday's season opener.
Thunder recalled F D.J. White from the Tulsa 66ers of the NBADL.
Tony Parker scored 19 points on 7-of-11 shooting with five rebounds, nine assists, and one steal in Saturday's blowout win over the Cavs.
Free agent center Erick Dampier will sign with the Heat on Tuesday.
According to beat writer Mike Wells, Josh McRoberts is expected to continue starting at power forward.
Coach Alvin Gentry wants to reduce Grant Hill's minutes.
George Hill (leg) left Monday's game against the Magic during the fourth quarter, and his return is questionable.
The Spurs have waived G/F Alonzo Gee.
The Magic officially signed point guard Chris Duhon on Thursday.
Antawn Jamison's troublesome left knee is limiting him to about 25 minutes a night.
Coach Larry Brown said that Tyrus Thomas' insertion into the starting lineup Wednesday night was simply matchup based.
Damien Wilkins returned from the flu on Saturday with nine points in 21 minutes, as Minnesota fell at home to the Heat.
The Clippers have reportedly signed Brian Cook to a two-year, $2.5 million deal.
Coach Doug Collins noted that Lou Williams hasn't been as aggressive going to the basket since suffering a shoulder injury last Wednesday.
James Posey returned to action from the flu on Wednesday and had five points in 19 minutes.
Dante Cunningham played 31 minutes and totaled 18 points, 10 rebounds and five turnovers on 8-of-12 shooting in Thursday's loss to the Jazz.
Ray Allen hit 9-of-14 shots and four 3-pointers for 24 points, five rebounds, two assists and two steals in Wednesday's win over the Knicks.
According to the Belgian media, veteran center D.J. Mbenga has agreed to a one-year deal with the Nuggets.
Anthony Parker is expected to return to action Tuesday as long as the swelling in his fingers continues to decrease.
Brandon Rush started over Mike Dunleavy on Wednesday night so he could guard Deron Williams.
Coach Paul Westphal said that DeMarcus Cousins' playing time will not be affected by him getting kicked out of Monday's practice.
Shaquille O'Neal was an unexcused absence from Monday's practice. Doc Rivers said the team has dealt with the situation and moved on.
Wizards coach Flip Saunders wasn't pleased with the performance of his three-guard lineup (John Wall, Gilbert Arenas, Kirk Hinrich) on Thursday.
The Hawks are expected to re-sign veteran center Jason Collins, though nothing is imminent since Collins is currently in Europe.
Darko Milicic hit just 2-of-10 shots for four points, six rebounds, four assists and a block before fouling out of Friday's loss to the Spurs.
Wizards owner Ted Leonsis flatly denied rumors that the Wizards are attempting to trade Gilbert Arenas.
Anderson Varejao had 10 points, 13 rebounds, a steal and block in Friday's loss to the Hornets.
Andre Miller scored 14 points on 7-of-10 shooting with one rebound and four assists on Saturday.
Raja Bell (thigh) will not play on Monday against the Thunder, and Gordon Hayward will start in his place.
Kobe Bryant hit 10-of-21 shots and three 3-pointers on his way to 31 points, three rebounds, three assists and a steal in Friday's loss to the Jazz.
Shaun Livingston (knee) and Gerald Henderson (knee) both say they will be ready for the season opener on Wednesday.
Kyle Lowry had 13 points, eight assists and six steals on 6-of-10 shooting in Monday's loss to the Suns.
Suns beat writer Paul Coro reports that Hakim Warrick will start in place of Hedo Turkoglu for Sunday's game against the Nuggets.
Ron Artest played just 21 minutes on Sunday, finishing a win over Golden State with two points, three assists, two steals, and two blocks.
Bucks swingman Chris Douglas-Roberts expects to resume contact drills in two weeks, following results of an examination Thursday.
